skillTree.localised_description: Heffengen, positioned in the centre of Ostermark, is known for being the breeding pot for one of the sturdiest breed of horses known to the Old World.
This Lord belts out orders and can be heard even across a battlefield smothered in the grim noise of war.
The relentless drive and fury of the Hammer, harnessed for the protection of this ward’s bearer.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Two-Gifts Day is a unusual holiday hailing from Ostermark, dedicated to Ranald. People present each other two gifts, one silly and one of value. After the gifts are handed over, it is ''fair game'' to steal gifts. Although ment to bring joy, Two-Gifts Day is the origin of many of family feuds and deadly duels.

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +25%

skillTree.localised_description: Von Kessel bares the scars of suspicion physically as well as mentally, unable to cure himself of his chaos mark. For penance, he swore life-long service to Sigmar, serving as one of his most loyal devotees in the battle against evil and destruction.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +20% when fighting against Greenskin Tribes, Skaven, Dark Elves, Beastmen Warherds, Chaos and Norsca

skillTree.localised_description: Every men within the league of Ostermark would be honoured to server under Van Kessel. His troops are known for digging into reserves beyond the phyiscal boundaries of other men. Often urged on by the shouts of their commander and the looming threat of Chaos, they dare push on where others would not.

effects.description:
Attribute: Strong Vigour when fighting against Greenskin Tribes, Skaven, Dark Elves, Beastmen Warherds, Chaos and Norsca
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: A noble griffon aided Von Kessel in the siege of Talabheim, making them inseperable ever since.
With rapid sweeps of his weapon, Stefan von Kessel cleaves off heads and limbs, inspiring his soldiers around him to fight with more verocity.
Stefan von Kessel commands his troops ruthlessly, moulding them into an efficient killing machine able of traversing the most rugged of regions within the Old World.

effects.description: Campaign movement range: +10% after winning a battle

Melee attack: +8 for Swordsmen and Greatswords
	(Lord's army)
Recruit rank: +3 for Swordsmen and Greatswords

skillTree.localised_description: Stefan von Kessel's reputation throughout the entirety of the Empire filled the hearts of many Ostermark denizens with pride. His name still whispered on the streets of Bechafen.

Not just protected by his armour, Stefan von Kessel’s pain threshold is far superior to his fellows, and he can fight on despite having suffered serious wounds. Often resulting in his soldiers to follow that example.
Such is the disdain Von Kessel holds for his enemies, that he and his soldiers shrug off their wounds and fight on. Often helped by the best equipment Ostermark has to offer.
Through force of will and dedicated study, Von Kessel off balances enemies whilst he swirls and swings through lines of infantry. His sheer determination manifests itself on the battlefield.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: “We march to war for our Emperor, and Sigmar, our saviour and lord.”

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
Revered by the masses, such a celebrated leader will inspire many new recruits.
The presence of this Lord ensures a measure of calm, reducing panic and desertion amongst followers.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Through our acts, the gods will cleanse the lands.
It is said that Sigmar would bear a mortal wound and carry on fighting; this champion follows the hallowed Warrior-God.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
Proficient with figures, this Lord, or his subordinates, can keep his army fulfilled, even in dire circumstances.
Countless conflicts and a keen sense of awareness have made this Lord difficult to entrap.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +5%
Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%

skillTree.localised_description: "Ever thought about joining the Elector's troops, chief? You'd make a good soldier alright."

items.colour_text: Stefan von Kessel swore to avenge his falsely accused family. The accuser, Count Von Gruber, had succumbed to the corruption of Nurgle. Gifts of Nurgle had made Otto immune for damage from common blades. Thus, Stefan went to find the blade of a former champion of Mandred Skavenslayer. This warrior had been slain in battle by a dreaded Vampire, with the sword taken as a trophy. Stefan would go on to fight the Undead Hordes of Waldakir Rahtep. Deep within this Vampire's Sanctum, Stefan finally came face to face with the Necrarch himself. He destroyed the sarcophagi that fuelled the creature's power and claimed the blade.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Von Kessel was accused for being the one thing he hated the most, and devoted his entire life proving his innocence by slaying the forces of Chaos.

effects.description:
Leadership: +5 when fighting against Warriors of Chaos, Chaos Dwarfs and Daemons of Chaos
	(Lord's army)

Experience gain for units: +50% when fighting against the Forces of Chaos
	(Lord's army)
